customer_addr:
W7593 TOWN HALL RD
SHARON, WI 53585

citations.narrative:
The area on the ground by where the grizzly bears eat and by their enrichment pool has pooling water that is dark or
green in color. Excess pooled water can create unsanitary conditions for the animals and increase flies/pests. Ensure that
these areas in the grizzly bear enclosure have drainage improved so that excess water can rapidly be eliminated.
***Correct by October 5, 2023.

Live rats or rat activity (burrows/holes) were seen in some enclosures during inspection:
-The black bear enclosure by the feeding area.
-Behind the shelters of the red fox, arctic fox, and raccoon enclosures.
-In the cavy enclosure by the feeder.
-In the African-crested enclosure by the feeder.
Rodent pests such as rats can increase risk of sickness and spread sicknesses. Ensure that a safe and effective program
for control all types of pests is in place and maintained.
***Correct by October 17, 2023

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility is providing enrichment and socialization for their birds, however does not have a plan for environment
enhancement for birds that has been approved by the attending veterinarian. An approved enrichment plan is required
and helps ensure species-appropriate enrichment and socialization is provided for exhibited birds.
Ensure that a documented enrichment plan that will be followed is approved by attending veterinarian.
***Correct by November 17, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.127(c) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The area on the ground by where the grizzly bears eat and by their enrichment pool has pooling water that is dark or 
green in color. Excess pooled water can create unsanitary conditions for the animals and increase flies/pests. Ensure that 
these areas in the grizzly bear enclosure have drainage improved so that excess water can rapidly be eliminated. 
***Correct by October 5, 2023. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
Live rats or rat activity (burrows/holes) were seen in some enclosures during inspection:  
 -The black bear enclosure by the feeding area.  
 -Behind the shelters of the red fox, arctic fox, and raccoon enclosures.  
 -In the cavy enclosure by the feeder.  
 -In the African-crested enclosure by the feeder.  
Rodent pests such as rats can increase risk of sickness and spread sicknesses. Ensure that a safe and effective program 
for control all types of pests is in place and maintained.  
***Correct by October 17, 2023 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility is providing enrichment and socialization for their birds, however does not have a plan for environment 
enhancement for birds that has been approved by the attending veterinarian. An approved enrichment plan is required 
and helps ensure species-appropriate enrichment and socialization is provided for exhibited birds.  
Ensure that a documented enrichment plan that will be followed is approved by attending veterinarian.  
***Correct by November 17, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
